Manich\u00e6ism: The doctrines taught, or system of principles maintained, by the Manichæans.
Mental: Of or pertaining to the mind; intellectual; as, mental faculties; mental operations, conditions, or exercise.
midterm: the middle of the gestation period.
Mammose: Having the form of the breast; breast-shaped.
Matricide: The murder of a mother by her son or daughter.
macrocephalic: Of or pertaining to macrocephaly; having an unusually large head.
&Verbar;Melan\u00e6mia: A morbid condition in which the blood contains black pigment either floating freely or imbedded in the white blood corpuscles.
Mesitylene: A colorless, fragrant liquid, C6H3(CH3)3, of the benzene series of hydrocarbons, obtained by distilling acetone with sulphuric acid.
male orchis: A Eurasian orchid (Orchis mascula) with showy pink or purple flowers in a loose spike.
Mithridatic: Of or pertaining to King Mithridates, or to a mithridate.
Mammaliferous: Containing mammalian remains; -- said of certain strata.
Mother Goose: The supposed author of a book of nursery rhymes first published as “Mother Goose's Melodies,” and usually called simply “Mother Goose.”  The first English edition is said to have been printed in 1719 in London.  The actual persons who composed the rhymes is unknown, and earlier similar rhymes in French are a likely source for some of them.  Mother Goose is also used as the title of a book of Mother Goose rhymes.
Middle-aged: Being about the middle of the ordinary age of man; early in the century, it was considered  between 30 and 50 years old, but by the end of the 19th centruy it was considered as 40 to 60.
Molle: Lower by a semitone; flat; as, E molle, that is, E flat.
Microweber: The millionth part of one weber.
Marry: Indeed! in truth! -- a term of asseveration said to have been derived from the practice of swearing by the Virgin Mary.
Morphean: Of or relating to Morpheus, to dreams, or to sleep.
Moravianism: The religious system of the Moravians.
Meresman: An officer who ascertains meres or boundaries.
&Verbar;Mormon: A genus of sea birds, having a large, thick bill; the puffin.
Monasticon: A book giving an account of monasteries.
man-sized: Calling for manly attributes; as, a man-sized job.
&Verbar;Meringue: A delicate pastry made of powdered sugar and the whites of eggs whipped up, -- with jam or cream added.
Magniloquent: Speaking pompously; using swelling discourse; bombastic; tumid in style; grandiloquent.
Moslem: Of or pertaining to the Mohammedans; Mohammedan; as, Moslem lands; the Moslem faith.
maidenhair tree: A deciduous dioecious gymnospermous Chinese tree (Ginkgo biloba) having fan-shaped leaves and fleshy yellow seeds, also called the ginkgo; it exists almost exclusively in cultivation esp. as an ornamental street tree.
Metonymy: A trope in which one word is put for another that suggests it; as, we say, a man keeps a good table instead of good provisions; we read Virgil, that is, his poems; a man has a warm heart, that is, warm affections; a city dweller has no wheels, that is, no automobile.
&Verbar;Melanoma: A tumor containing dark pigment.  Such tumors are usually malignant and often fatal.
Merrymaking: The act of making merry; conviviality; merriment; jollity.
Matchmaker: One who makes matches for burning or kinding.
monopteral: Round and without a cella; consisting of a single ring of columns supporting a roof; -- said esp. of a temple.
Musculophrenic: Pertaining to the muscles and the diaphragm; as, the musculophrenic artery.
Marriageable: Fit for, or capable of, marriage; of an age at which marriage is allowable.
Mammea americana: The speciaes name for the mammee tree.
Mesomyodous: Having the intrinsic muscles of the larynx attached to the middle of the semirings.
Mutessarif: In Turkey prior to the revolution, an administrative authority of any of certain sanjaks.  They were appointed directly by the Sultan.
mid-seventies: the time of life between 70 and 80.
Minishment: The act of diminishing, or the state of being diminished; diminution.
Maieutics: The art of giving birth (i. e., clearness and conviction) to ideas, which are conceived as struggling for birth.
Muteness: The quality or state of being mute; speechlessness.
Morone: Maroon; the color of an unripe black mulberry.
magnetic resonance imaging: a medical diagnostic procedure utilizing the phenomenon of nuclear magnetic resonance to generate images of internal parts of the body.  It depends on the differential absorption of electromagnetic radiation by different types of living tissue in a magnetic field.  It is complementary to X-ray imaging in that the softer tissue show more prominently in magnetic resonance images, rather than bone, as with X-rays.  It is a non-invasive procedure, allowing such images to be obtained without penetration of the tissue by objects.  It is abbreviated MRI.  As with computerized tomography, the results are usually presented as images of sequential planar sections of that part of the body of concern to the physician.
myelin: A soft white substance constituting the medullary sheaths of nerve fibers, and composed mainly of cholesterin, lecithin, cerebrin, protein, and some fat.
Mattock: An implement for digging and grubbing.  The head has two long steel blades, one like an adz and the other like a narrow ax or the point of a pickax.
Murmuration: The act of murmuring; a murmur.
Miscredent: A miscreant, or believer in a false religious doctrine.
&Verbar;Minimus: A being of the smallest size.
Motherless: Destitute of a mother; having lost a mother; as, motherless children.
master-at-arms: The senior petty officer of a ship, responsible for discipline aboard the ship.
Mourne: The armed or feruled end of a staff; in a sheephook, the end of the staff to which the hook is attached.
Menopause: The period of natural cessation of menstruation. See Change of life, under Change.
Mammuthus: An extinct genus comprising the mammoths.
Multocular: Having many eyes, or more than two.
Melenite: An explosive of great destructive power; -- so called from its color, which resembles honey.
molality: A measure of concentaration of substances in mixtures, 1 molal being the concentration of a solution containing 1 mole of solute per 1000 grams of solvent.  Compare molar.
Maleyl: A hypothetical radical derived from maleic acid.
Misrecollect: To have an erroneous remembrance of; to suppose erroneously that one recollects.
mackerel sky: A sky filled with rows of cirrocumulus or small altocumulus clouds.
Machilidae: A natural family of insects including the jumping bristletails.
&Verbar;Mudar: Either one of two asclepiadaceous shrubs (Calotropis gigantea, and Calotropis procera), which furnish a strong and valuable fiber.  The acrid milky juice is used medicinally.
Monotone: A single unvaried tone or sound.
MASH: An abbreviation for Mobile Army Surgical Hospital, consisting of the equipment and personnel required to perform emergency operations on injured soldiers, located in tents near the front lines of combat; as, he worked in the 25th MASH.
Magnanimous: Great of mind; elevated in soul or in sentiment; raised above what is low, mean, or ungenerous; of lofty and courageous spirit; as, a magnanimous character; a magnanimous conqueror.
Meteoroidal: Of or pertaining to a meteoroid or to meteoroids.
&Verbar;Memento mori: Lit., remember to die, i.e., that you must die; a warning to be prepared for death; an object, as a death's-head or a personal ornament, usually emblematic, used as a reminder of death.
Miasmology: That department of medical science which treats of miasma.
Mouth-footed: Having the basal joints of the legs converted into jaws.
Monandrous: Of or pertaining to the monandria; having but one stamen.
Menispermic: Pertaining to, or obtained from, moonseed (Menispermum), or other plants of the same family, as the Anamirta Cocculus.
Montanist: A follower of Mintanus, a Phrygian enthusiast of the second century, who claimed that the Holy Spirit, the Paraclete, dwelt in him, and employed him as an instrument for purifying and guiding men in the Christian life.
meritocratic: Of or pertaining to meritocracy; as, meritocratic society.
monkeywrench: A wrench or spanner which has one fixed and one adjustable jaw.
Matabele: A warlike South African Kaffir tribe.
Metastannic: Pertaining to, or designating, a compound of tin (metastannic acid), obtained, as an isomeric modification of stannic acid, in the form of a white amorphous substance.
Misbear: To carry improperly; to carry (one's self) wrongly; to misbehave.
Mastersinger: One of a class of poets which flourished in Nuremberg and some other cities of Germany in the 15th and 16th centuries.  They bound themselves to observe certain arbitrary laws of rhythm.
Muzzle-loader: A firearm which receives its charge through the muzzle, as distinguished from one which is loaded at the breech.
Milkweed: Any plant of the genera Asclepias and Acerates, abounding in a milky juice, and having its seed attached to a long silky down; silkweed.  The name is also applied to several other plants with a milky juice, as to several kinds of spurge.  Its leaves are a favorite food source for the larvae of the monarch butterfly.
muezzin: A Mohammedan crier of the hour of prayer; the Moslem official of a mosque who summons the faithful to prayer from a minaret five times a day.
&Verbar;Mattoir: A kind of coarse punch with a rasplike face, used for making a rough surface on etching ground, or on the naked copper, the effect after biting being very similar to stippled lines.
Meteorologic: Of or pertaining to the atmosphere and its phenomena, or to meteorology.
Michelangelo: Michelangelo Buonarroti, renowned Italian painter, sculptor and architect; 1475-1564.
&Verbar;Maia: A genus of spider crabs, including the common European species (Maia squinado).
&Verbar;Mores: Customs; habits; esp., moral customs conformity to which is more or less obligatory; customary law.
Mechanico-chemical: Pertaining to, connected with, or dependent upon, both mechanics and chemistry; -- said especially of those sciences which treat of such phenomena as seem to depend on the laws both of mechanics and chemistry, as electricity and magnetism.
Moldable: Capable of being molded or formed.
Missive: That which is sent; a writing containing a message.
Mastiff: A breed of large dogs noted for strength and courage.  There are various strains, differing in form and color, and characteristic of different countries.
Manifest: To show plainly; to make to appear distinctly, -- usually to the mind; to put beyond question or doubt; to display; to exhibit.
Marline: To wind marline around; as, to marline a rope.
meningeal: Of or pertaining to the meninges.
Moneywort: A trailing plant (Lysimachia Nummularia), with rounded opposite leaves and solitary yellow flowers in their axils.
Monarchal: Pertaining to a monarch; suiting a monarch; sovereign; regal; imperial.
Megacephalic: Large headed; -- applied to animals, and to plants when they have large flower heads.
Measurer: One who measures; one whose occupation or duty is to measure commondities in market.
micron: A measure of length; the thousandth part of one millimeter; the millionth part of a meter.
Measured: Regulated or determined by a standard; hence, equal; uniform; graduated; limited; moderated; as, he walked with measured steps; he expressed himself in no measured terms.
Matricaria: A genus of chiefly Old World strong-smelling weedy herbs; it comprises plants sometimes included in other genera, such as Tanacetum and  Tripleurospermum.
Mentally: In the mind; in thought or meditation; intellectually; in idea.
Myriological: Of or relating to a myriologue.
Mute: One who does not speak, whether from physical inability, unwillingness, or other cause.
Move: The act of moving; a movement.
Mesologarithm: A logarithm of the cosine or cotangent.
malodorousness: The attribute of having a strong offensive smell.
Macrocosmic: Of or pertaining to the macrocosm.
Misanthropy: Hatred of, or dislike to, mankind; -- opposed to philanthropy.
mashed potato: the name of a dance, briefly popular in the 1960's.
manicotti: Tubular large noodles that are usually stuffed with mild cheese and baked in tomato sauce; -- a type of Italian pasta; also a dish of such noodles thus prepared.
Marginally: In the margin of a book.
magnetic storm: A sudden disturbance of the earth's magnetic field; caused by emission of particles from the sun.
magus: a magician or sorcerer of ancient times.
&Verbar;Mur\u00e6na: A genus of large eels of the family Murænidæ. They differ from the common eel in lacking pectoral fins and in having the dorsal and anal fins continuous.  The murry (Muræna Helenæ) of Southern Europe was the muræna of the Romans.  It is highly valued as a food fish.
Minute: To set down a short sketch or note of; to jot down; to make a minute or a brief summary of.
Mashy: Produced by crushing or bruising; resembling, or consisting of, a mash.
Modesty: The quality or state of being modest; that lowly temper which accompanies a moderate estimate of one's own worth and importance; absence of self-assertion, arrogance, and presumption; humility respecting one's own merit.
&Verbar;Myxocystodea: A division of Infusoria including the Noctiluca.  See Noctiluca.
Mahratta: One of a numerous people inhabiting the southwestern part of India. Also, the language of the Mahrattas; Mahrati. It is closely allied to Sanskrit.
Mortify: To lose vitality and organic structure, as flesh of a living body; to gangrene.
makomako: A graceful deciduous shrub or small tree (Aristotelia serrata) having attractive foliage and small red berries that turn black at maturity and are used for making wine.
Misread: To read amiss; to misunderstand in reading.
Mummification: The act of making a mummy.
Meazling: Falling in small drops; mistling; mizzing.
Monarchy: A state or government in which the supreme power is lodged in the hands of a monarch.
Monocarpellary: Consisting of a single carpel, as the fruit of the pea, cherry, and almond.
Monarcho: The nickname of a crackbrained Italian who fancied himself an emperor.
mike: A microphone, the device for converting sound waves into electrical energy.
Magnate: A person of rank; a noble or grandee; a person of influence or distinction in any sphere; -- used mostly of prominent business executives; as, an industrial magnate.
Missound: To sound wrongly; to utter or pronounce incorrectly.
Metabolize: To change by a metabolic process. See Metabolism.
misandrist: one who hates men.  Contrast misogynist and cf. misandry.
Marmalade: A preserve or confection made of the pulp of fruit, as the quince, pear, apple, orange, etc., boiled with sugar, and brought to a jamlike consistency.
Mother-naked: Naked as when born; completely naked.
major-league: Of or pertaining to a major league; as, major-league football rules.
mandril: any of various shafts that rotate or serve as axes for larger rotating parts.
&Verbar;Myrica: A widely dispersed genus of shrubs and trees, usually with aromatic foliage.  It includes the bayberry or wax myrtle, the sweet gale, and the North American sweet fern, so called.
Micro\u00f6rganism: Any microscopic form of life; a form of life too small to be seen by the naked eye; -- particularly applied to bacteria, protozoa, yeasts, and similar organisms, esp. such are supposed to cause infectious diseases.
&Verbar;Mira: A remarkable variable star in the constellation Cetus (ο Ceti).
Metacinnabarite: Sulphide of mercury in isometric form and black in color.
meticulosity: strict attention to minute details; the quality of being meticulous.
Motacil: Any singing bird of the genus Motacilla; a wagtail.
mosquitofish: A silvery topminnow (Gambusia affinis) with rows of black spots of tropical North America and West Indies; important in mosquito control.
Morbillous: Pertaining to the measles; partaking of the nature of measels, or resembling the eruptions of that disease; measly.
magnetic dipole: A dipole with opposing magnetic poles.
Moistness: The quality or state of being moist.
maintop: The platform about the head of the mainmast in square-rigged vessels.
Muzarabic: Of or pertaining to Muzarabs; as, the Muzarabic liturgy.
Misfortune: To happen unluckily or unfortunately; to miscarry; to fail.
Monsels salt: A basic sulphate of iron; -- so named from Monsel, a Frenchman.
Mien: Aspect; air; manner; demeanor; carriage; bearing.
&Verbar;Monas: A genus of minute flagellate Infusoria of which there are many species, both free and attached. See Illust. under Monad.
Microscopically: By the microscope; with minute inspection; in a microscopic manner.
Manhattan Project: A former US agency that was responsible for developing atomic bombs during World War II.
Modulation: The act of modulating, or the state of being modulated; as, the modulation of the voice.
Missal: Of or pertaining to the Mass, or to a missal or Mass book.
mail slot: A usually horizontal slot in a door through which mail can be delivered.  It often has a hinged cover to keep the opening cloised when not in use.
Manhole: A hole through which a man may descend or creep into a drain, sewer, steam boiler, parts of machinery, etc., for cleaning or repairing.
&Verbar;Monandria: A Linnæan class of plants embracing those having but a single stamen.
mail carrier: A person who delivers the mail; -- also called a letter carrier.  A male mail carrier is also called a mailman.
Mistakable: Liable to be mistaken; capable of being misconceived.
&Verbar;Mysis: A genus of small schizopod shrimps found both in fresh and salt water; the opossum shrimps.  One species inhabits the Great Lakes of North America, and is largely eaten by the whitefish.  The marine species form part of the food of right whales.
Manufacturing: Employed, or chiefly employed, in manufacture; as, a manufacturing community; a manufacturing town.
Modifiable: Capable of being modified; liable to modification.
myxedema: A pathological condition due to severe hyperthyroidism, marked by dry skin and swellings around lips and nose as well as mental and physical deterioration.
Meterage: The act of measuring, or the cost of measuring.
Microphytal: Pertaining to, or of the nature of, microphytes.
Monopersonal: Having but one person, or form of existence.
Mismanagement: Wrong or bad management; as, he failed through mismagement.
Misvalue: To value wrongly or too little; to undervalue.
Mizzen: The hindmost of the fore and aft sails of a three-masted vessel; also, the spanker.
Movableness: The quality or state of being movable; mobility; susceptibility of motion.
Milker: One who milks; also, a mechanical apparatus for milking cows.
Marginate: To furnish with a distinct margin; to margin.
Multitubular: Having many tubes; as, a multitubular boiler.
Manipulation: The act or process of manipulating, or the state of being manipulated; the act of handling work by hand; use of the hands, in an artistic or skillful manner, in science or art.
mined: extracted from a source of supply as of minerals from the earth.
minor league: A league of professional sports teams less proficient than a major leagues.  Players in the minor leagues generally are paid less than those in the major leagues, and their games attract less atention.
Monometallist: One who believes in monometallism as opposed to bimetallism, etc.
Mediation: The act of mediating; action or relation of anything interposed; action as a necessary condition, means, or instrument; interposition; intervention.
Mussulmanic: Of, pertaining to, or like, the Mussulmans, or their customs: Mohammedan.
&Verbar;Mephitis: Noxious, pestilential, or foul exhalations from decomposing substances, filth, or other source.
Maud: A gray plaid; -- used by shepherds in Scotland.
Maul: To beat and bruise with a heavy stick or cudgel; to wound in a coarse manner.
Monometallism: The legalized use of one metal only, as gold, or silver, in the standard currency of a country, or as a standard of money values. See Bimetallism.
&Verbar;Maholi: A South African lemur (Galago maholi), having very large ears.
Major-domo: A man who has authority to act, within certain limits, as master of the house; a steward; also, a chief minister or officer.
Momordica: A genus of Old World tropical vine.
mail-order buying: The buying and selling of goods to be shipped from the vendor through the mail to the purchaser.  Information about to be purchased may be found in catalogs, advertisements, on the web, etc., and purchase orders transmitted to the vendor by mail, telephone, or internet connection.
&Verbar;Maestro: A master in any art, especially in music; a composer or orchestra conductor.
Mugiloid: Like or pertaining to the genus Mugil, or family Mugilidæ.
Monadelphian: Of or pertaining to the Monadelphia; having the stamens united in one body by the filaments.
Marseilles: A general term for certain kinds of fabrics, which are formed of two series of threads interlacing each other, thus forming double cloth, quilted in the loom; -- so named because first made in Marseilles, France.
Magna Carta: The great Charter, so called, obtained by the English barons from King John, A. D. 1215.  This name is also given to the charter granted to the people of England in the ninth year of Henry III., and confirmed by Edward I.
&Verbar;Materia medica: Material or substance used in the composition of remedies; -- a general term for all substances used as curative agents in medicine.
&Verbar;Monsignore: My lord; -- an ecclesiastical dignity bestowed by the pope, entitling the bearer to social and domestic rank at the papal court. (Abbrev. Mgr.)
Mesoscapular: Of or pertaining to the mesoscapula.
mayapple: North American herb (Podophyllum peltatum) with poisonous root stock and an edible though insipid egg-shaped yellowish fruit; called also wild mandrake.
Monkish: Like a monk, or pertaining to monks; monastic; as, monkish manners; monkish dress; monkish solitude.
Miscellane: A mixture of two or more sorts of grain; -- now called maslin and meslin.
&Verbar;Mardi gras: The last day of Carnival; the Tuesday before Ash Wednesday (the beginning of Lent and fasting); Shrove Tuesday; -- in some cities a great day of carnival and merrymaking; in the United States it is especially associated with New Orleans.
Materialization: The act of materializing, or the state of being materialized.
Momentariness: The state or quality of being momentary; shortness of duration.
Maundril: A pick with two prongs, to pry with.
moorhen: A black gallinule (Gallinula chloropus) that inhabits ponds and lakes.
Mansard roof: A hipped curb roof; that is, a roof having on all sides two slopes, the lower one being steeper than the upper one.
Mandrel: A bar of metal inserted in the work to shape it, or to hold it, as in a lathe, during the process of manufacture; an arbor.
meaningless: having no meaning; of no value; as, a meaningless endeavor; a meaningless life; a meaningless explanation.  Opposite of meaningful.
&Verbar;Mandator: A director; one who gives a mandate or order.
Myriameter: A metric measure of length, containing ten thousand meters.  It is equal to 6.2137 miles.
Mythologist: One versed in, or who writes on, mythology or myths.
Molten: Melted; being in a state of fusion, esp. when the liquid state is produced by a high degree of heat; as, molten iron.
&Verbar;Malacopoda: A class of air-breathing Arthropoda; -- called also Protracheata, and Onychophora.
Misshapen: Having a bad or ugly form.
Monesia: The bark, or a vegetable extract brought in solid cakes from South America and believed to be derived from the bark, of the tree Chrysophyllum glycyphlœum.  It is used as an alterative and astringent.
Monesin: The acrid principle of Monesia, sometimes used as a medicine.
Mid sea: The middle part of the sea or ocean.
Massasauga: The black rattlesnake (Crotalus tergemina, or Caudisona tergemina), found in the Mississippi Valley.
myxomycete: an organism of the class Myxomycetes.
Mushy: Soft like mush; figuratively, good-naturedly weak and effusive; weakly sentimental.
Manteltree: The lintel of a fireplace when of wood, as frequently in early houses.
Marble: To stain or vein like marble; to variegate in color; as, to marble the edges of a book, or the surface of paper.
Millionary: Of or pertaining to millions; consisting of millions; as, the millionary chronology of the pundits.
Misassay: To assay, or attempt, improperly or unsuccessfully.
Multipresence: The state or power of being multipresent.
Mycomelic: Pertaining to, or designating, a complex nitrogenous acid of the alloxan group, obtained as a honey-yellow powder.  Its solutions have a gelatinous consistency.
